bibl.title: From Athens to Alexandria: Hellenism and Social Goals in Ptolemaic Egypt.
bibl.note: Introduction: On the Economic Goals and Tacit Assumptions. - Ch. I: The Greek Background. - Ch. II: Economics and Technology in Ptol. Egypt. - Ch. III: Culture and Society of the Greeks in Egypt. - Ch. IV: The Stability of Greek Culture in Egypt.
bibl.seg: Samuel Alan E., From Athens to Alexandria: Hellenism and Social Goals in Ptolemaic Egypt. (Studia Hellenistica. 26.)

Introduction: On the Economic Goals and Tacit Assumptions. - Ch. I: The Greek Background. - Ch. II: Economics and Technology in Ptol. Egypt. - Ch. III: Culture and Society of the Greeks in Egypt. - Ch. IV: The Stability of Greek Culture in Egypt.

C.R. par Jean Bingen, ChrEg 61 (1986) No. 121, pp. 164-165. - E. Borza, AHR 90 (1985) pp. 910-911. - Peter M. Fraser, Phoenix 40 (1986) pp. 110-102. - Reinhold Scholl, Gnomon 57 (1985) pp. 477-479. - Lucia Criscuolo, Aegyptus 68 (1988) pp. 263-264. - Werner Huss, BibO 44 (1987) coll. 158-160. - J. David Thomas CR N.S., 38 (1988) pp. 91-92. - Dorothy J. Thompson, JHS 107 (1987) pp. 240-241.
